messages.message: After compiling an app, can we show "Keep editing" as the secondary button or maybe keep as is but add a close button in top right? it'll be helpful to see the current state of the project
@jack.robbins should be easy to implement, what do you think?

cc @alagu - seems reasonable to have another button or an X in the top right of the modal?

From a customer perspective,  after creating a new version they may also want to kick-off an accuracy test or manually run a file through the app using the new version. Might be worth looking at that holistically and offer more 'quick' options to those other flows?

• yes, we should definitely add the 'x'.
• i'd suggest we collect specific customer feedback before changing/adding CTAs in this modal because open app takes the user to the app overview page from where accessing the project, runs, accuracy tests, etc. is easy. we used to have links to potentially useful functionalities linked in one of the previous versions and it resulted in a lot of noise/too many options.
• i'm also curious if users click on the _go to hub_ CTA from this modal.

Agree with siyas suggestions here, Lets definitely add the 'X' to the modal - is there any data on how many actually click go to hub? if not high we can consider replacing with continue editing...would be great to test this change with some users if possible.
